intro: Castanospermum, commonly known as the Australian ironwood, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Sapotaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to Australia and New Guinea. These plants are characterized by their large, glossy leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that range from yellow to red. The hard, dense wood of Castanospermum is highly valued for its strength and durability. Some species are also cultivated for their ornamental value and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
